intro: Sisymbrium berlandieri, commonly known as the Mexican winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is an annual herb that typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium berlandieri is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants.
